meaningMnemonic: There are <radical>flowers</radical> growing around a <radical>heart</radical> with a <kanji>wick</kanji> sticking out of it. The heart is a sacrifice to the old gods and the life energy bleeds from the burning wick to feed the flowers. The wick burns, releasing the power of the heart which spreads into the ground around the heart causing the flowers to grow.
readingMnemonic: Sometimes the <kanji>wick</kanji> burning the heart isn’t enough for the flowers to grow properly and they get thirsty for the blood from your <reading>shin</reading> (しん). So, you slice open your shin with a sacrificial knife and drip your blood over the thirsty demon flowers.
